raw_comment:
I notice that for every category there is a lower percentage of young men than women who reach out to there parents often. Actually there is a higher percentage of young women who Call or video chat their parents often than the percentage of men who just text their parents often. I wonder what gender has to do with the percentages of young adults talking to their parents. Why are males less often talk to their parents than females. Is this because males tend to have less of a relationship with parents than women, or is this hormonal? This relates to my community because I am currently attending high school, and around this time many teens are turning into young adults. This causes children to grow away from there parents which makes this graph almost directly representative of me and my peers.
Are You Contacting Your Parents Enough?
ace_sentences: I notice a pattern in every category.
In every category, a lower percentage of young men reach out to their parents often than young women.
A higher percentage of young women call or video-chat their parents often than young men.
A lower percentage of young men call or video-chat their parents often than young women.
The percentage of young women who call or video-chat their parents often is higher than the percentage of young men who only text their parents often.
I wonder how gender relates to these percentages.
I ask why young men talk to their parents less often than young women.
One possible reason is that young men have weaker relationships with their parents than young women.
Another possible reason is that hormones influence this behavior.
This topic relates to my community.
Many teens become young adults around this time.
This change causes some children to grow away from their parents.
This graph is representative of me and my peers.
The headline is: Are you contacting your parents enough?
